snippet: Republicans have unveiled a drill-now-drill-everywhere bill to replace Obama’s sensible plan that would allow drilling in the Gulf of Mexico and Alaska.
abstract: Editorial observes that Republicans and Mitt Romney are criticizing Pres Obama again for not moving swiftly enough to tap the nation's considerable offshore reserves of oil and natural gas; contends that the criticism is tired, and that the Republicans' assertion that a country with only 2 percent of the world's oil reserves can drill its way to energy independence is environmentally irresponsible and the stuff of fantasy.
lead_paragraph: Republicans have unveiled a drill-now-drill-everywhere bill to replace Obama’s sensible plan that would allow drilling in the Gulf of Mexico and Alaska.
